abstracts.cdata!:
The Housing Finance Project for Portugal
            was cancelled before the loan was signed because the
            Government preferred alternative funds to implement the
            project. The project was appraised in October 1984 and
            approved by the loan on December 3, 1985. Official notice of
            cancellation was sent to the Government on April 6, 1987.
            The project fell victim to a series of various external
            circumstances whose importance was not necessarily
            foreseeable during project appraisal. Political instability
            in the country and changes in the institutional framework
            for housing finance were contributing issues. The main
            problem, however, was that by the time the loan was
            approved, Portugal had gained access to sources of funding
            for low-income housing that were offering resources under
            more favorable and less stringent conditions than those
            offered by the Bank. There was full agreement with the
            designated implementing agency about the project goals.
            Although the loan never became effective, Bank staff
            estimated that through its very preparation it had a strong
            and positive impact on Portugal's housing finance
            intermediary (sound financial policy) and its lending
            program (focus on moderate income groups with appropriate
            designs and lowered construction standards). In hindsight,
            it seems that the Bank probably underestimated the risks
            stemming from the availability of other funding sources. The
            experience of this project confirms that the Bank can, apart
            from its resource transfer role, contribute to institutional
            development through advisory inputs at the project inception
            and preparation stages. The overall project outcome and its
            sustainability cannot be rated. Institutional development is
            rated as substantial.
